title: formatting error with text wrapping around table on thunderbird 115.2.2
content:
i recently updated thunderbird and when i send an email with a table in it does some sort of weird formatting where the text underneath the table wraps around the table so it will appear on the side of the table instead of underneath (see attached screenshot). the only way i can see to get around this is to leave about 12 paragraph spaces between the table and text, but for someone receiving the email that doesn't have thunderbird, i imagine this would appear as a huge blank space which would also look weirdly formatted. does anyone know how to get around this?

thanks
creator: emmett.roberts

title: layout changed with new version -- how to fix it back?
content:
Changes/updates occurred today to Thunderbird creating problems. Current Thunderbird version is: 115.2.2 (32-bit) However, computer is: 64-bit running Windows 11

Changes observed:

  • Icon on desktop changed
  • The left pane no longer shows the number of messages in a folder--only the number of unread messages
  • When changing a message filter, the window is too big, and I cannot approve any changes--the buttons at the bottom are too far down and are inaccessible. It is not possible to adjust the window size.

The inability to change the message filters is a major problem. I have tried changing:

  • Font size
  • View
  • Density

I have also tried restarting Thunderbird and rebooting. None of these make any difference.

What should I do?

-DT
creator: pab39612

title: Reverting from Thunderbird 'Upgrade' 115.2.2 (32 Bit) Supernova
content:
How do I correct my serious error (when tired) in allowing a Thunderbird 'Upgrade' 115.2.2 (32 Bit) Supernova to install on my Laptop (Windows 10 Home, 64 Bit). I failed to read the Release Notes by trusting Mozilla wouldn't issue such a drastic change without Warnings as it was not just an 'Upgrade'! It has screwed up my Set up, Folders etc., completely changed layout, can't find 'Write Message' tab etc. etc . etc.

The previous Thunderbird Version had many problems further introduced by 'Upgrades' but was at least still had continuity with earlier Versions with a functional MMI (man machine interface) instead of all the changes introduced with the 115.2.2, which in my opinion should be withdrawn completely. N.B My experience in Systems Control, as an Air Traffic Control Engineer, we would throw this out as not fit for purpose.

Help Please and explain how can I revert back to an Earlier Version?

creator: axw

title: Permanent addres book down loading message (Thunderbird/Linux, using shared profile between user account)
content:
I am the sole user on a Linux-desktop and have an 'admin' (sudo'er) and 'normal' user account.

They both run Thunderbird (v115) and access a common/shared profile in a shared directory under /home.

Both users successfully send/receive emails and administrate the local-folders' architectures.

However, the 'normal' user, upon opening Thunderbird has the Address book downloading.. window permanently displayed. The messages ends with (undefined).

There appears to be multiple instances stacked/repeated behind the displayed one. Otherwise Thunderbird provides normal use with the permanent message window going to the background. The 'cancel' button returns a 'kill' button which simply returns an 'ok' when repeatedly hit. Closing Thunderbird does not close the message window.

The 'admin' user does not have this problem. The message window briefly appears then closes.

The shared folder was created by 'admin' (sudo'er) and its parent is /home. Ownership is admin:public. Group public has only admin and 'normal' user as its members. There is no user called 'public'.

Shared folder is set with access rights '2774'. The old profile from 'admin' was initially copied into the new created Thunderbird profile. This had worked for 'admin' but the 'normal' user received an announcement stating "Thunderbird is already open" and so could go no further. Setting all group access rights to '7' (rwx) in the shared profile resolved this.

Not life-threatening but any help would be appreciated.

Linux 6.1.51-1-MANJARO Thunderbird 6.1.51-1-MANJARO Mozilla (Thunderbird for Manjaro LinuxManjaro - 1.0) HW Thinkpad T420 (???? a.d.)
creator: peter_pollard

title: Attachment pane too small

title: Laptop YEnilemesinde hesap açılmıyor.
content:
Merhaba,

Yandex tabanlı mail adresimizde thundbirdden ulaşmak istiyoruz. İnternet arayüzünden yandex in kendi sitesinden parolası doğru olup girdiğimiz mail adresine maalesef thundbirdden giremiyoruz. Sunucuya erişemedi parola yanlış şeklinde hata veriyor. Ve bu yüzden thundbird kullanamayacağız. Bu hesap diğer başka bilgisayarda aktif çalışırken laptop yenilemesinden diğer yeni laptopta açamıyoruz. Çok garip. Nasıl yapabiliriz.

title: Only a subset of the selected items get moved
content:
When I select a large number of messages in my Inbox and move them to a different folder, only a subset of the selected messages get moved.

Procedure: I select a message, scroll backwards in the message list by several months, then shift-click another message, causing all messages between those two to also be selected. Then I either left-click and drag the messages to another folder, or right-click and Move To a different folder. Initially, all the messages disappear from my Inbox, giving the appearance that they all have moved to the folder, but one by one, many of the messages reappear in Inbox.

The folder is not a local folder--It's a folder on the server. It seems that the number of messages that successfully move is limited to about 200 messages, but it varies. For example, I selected and moved 211 messages, but when they finished moving, 17 messages returned to the Inbox. The messages that returned are not in the folder that I moved the messages to -- They either didn't move, or they moved and then returned to Inbox.

I'm using Thunderbird 115.1.1 with an IMAP Yahoo mail account.
creator: drkaden

title: Donations and Contact
content:
Hi

Why does Thunderbird want all my personal information.......??

I'd be MORE THAN happy to make a donation to support you guys, but I am NOT happy about all the info I have to provide - and frankly I'm bot going to be bullied into giving info I don't want to. I donate to Wikipedia and they don't ask such intrusive questions - so why do you? You say that less than 2% of TB users donate - this PROBABLY the reason why they don't...!

And the fact that there is no direct link to ask somebody ask question about this subject, is really frustrating.

Thanks
